task.title: Writing to the Destination
task.shortdesc: You can use the Hadoop FS destination to write tutorial data to a Hadoop file system or a local directory.

context.p: When you configure the output file properties, you define the directory template, which determines the naming convention for the output directories that are created. Use the directory where you want the output files to be written.

step.cmd: From the stage library, select the Hadoop FS processor and connect it to the previous stage.
With the destination selected, in the Properties panel, click the Hadoop FS tab. If you have a real Hadoop FS installation, configure the stage to write to it.
step.info: To use Hadoop FS to write to a local filesystem, enter the following configuration for the Hadoop FS URI property: file:///.

row.entry:
Use the output directory where you want the files to be written and optionally include constants to indicate the frequency at which the files should be rolled over.
For example the following directory rolls the output file once a year, but works for this tutorial: <output directory>/${YYYY()}.
If writing to a local file system, you might prefer to lower the file size to something manageable, like 5.
